tit.cmt: タイトルのため、各単語の頭文字を大文字にしました。

sen.j: 天正の地割（てんしょうのじわり）または天正地割とは、天正年間に豊臣秀吉によって行なわれた、京都における新たな通りの建設、およびそれにともなう町割の変更である。
sen.e: During the Tensho era Kyoto underwent city redevelopment ordered by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI, which includes the construction of new roads and subsequent change to administrative divisions.

tit.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 平安京の通りは東西、南北とも約120m間隔であり、京内は正方形状の町に区画されていた。
sen.e: Both north-south and east-west roads in Heiankyo were arranged at intervals of about 120 meters, dividing Kyoto into square-shaped administrative districts.

sen.j: これらの区画は当初貴族の邸宅や官吏の住居に利用されていたが、建物が直接通りに接するか否かでの有利不利は特になかった。
sen.e: These divisions were used for the boundaries of nobles mansions and government officials' residences, but whether their houses directly face a street is not a matter of advantages or disadvantages.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: These divisions were used to denote the boundaries of nobles mansions and government officials' residences, but there was no particular advantage or disadvantage as to whether the house directly faced a street.

sen.j: しかし商業が発達してくると、通りに面した位置が有利であることから、間口が通りに向いた形の建物が増加した。
sen.e: With the development of commerce, however, houses with their frontage facing a street were increasingly built, because facing a street is an advantage.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: With the development of commerce, however, an increasing number of houses ere built with their front facing the street due to the inherent advantage of such construction.

sen.j: 室町時代にはほぼすべての建物が間口を通りに向ける形になり、同じ通りの両側の地域が一つの「町」を形成するようになる（両側町）。
sen.e: By the Muromachi era almost all houses had been built with a frontage facing a street, and thereby areas on both sides of a street began to constitute a "machi" (Both-side town(Ryogawa machi)).

sen.j: 1590年（天正18年）、豊臣秀吉は南北方向の通りの中間に新たに通りを建設し、これまで空き地だったところを新たな「町」にした。
sen.e: In 1590, Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI built roads between north-south streets, making the vacant lots into new "machi."
